entities.name: hallway
entities.description: The hallway is described as eerie and cobwebbed with the outlines of house-elf heads on the wall throwing odd shadows up the staircase. It looked just as Harry remembered it.

entities.name: house-elf
entities.description: The house-elf heads are mentioned on the wall in the hallway, throwing odd shadows up the staircase.

entities.name: Sirius's mother
entities.description: The portrait of Sirius's mother is concealed by long dark curtains in the hallway.

entities.name: troll
entities.description: A troll's leg umbrella stand is mentioned as being out of place in the hallway.

entities.name: Tonks
entities.description: Tonks is mentioned as possibly knocking over the troll's leg umbrella stand.

entities.name: Hermione
entities.description: Hermione whispers to Ron, pointing toward the troll's leg umbrella stand.

entities.name: Ron
entities.description: Ron murmurs back to Hermione, suggesting that the jinxes might only be activated if Snape shows up.

entities.name: Harry
entities.description: Harry asks about the jinxes and takes a step forward into the house.

entities.name: Snape
entities.description: Snape is mentioned as possibly being in the house, with jinxes put up against him.

entities.name: Mad-Eye Moody
entities.description: Mad-Eye Moody's voice whispers out of the darkness, making Harry and his friends jump back in fright.

relationships.description: The hallway is described as looking just as Harry remembered it, indicating that he has visited the hallway before.
Tonks is mentioned as possibly knocking over the troll's leg umbrella stand, indicating a relationship between Tonks and the umbrella stand.
Hermione whispers to Ron, pointing toward the troll's leg umbrella stand, indicating a relationship between Hermione and the umbrella stand.
Ron suggests that the jinxes might only be activated if Snape shows up, indicating a relationship between Ron and the umbrella stand.
Harry asks about the jinxes put up against Snape, indicating that he is concerned about Snape's presence in the house.
Mad-Eye Moody's voice whispers out of the darkness, making Harry and his friends jump back in fright, indicating that Mad-Eye Moody is scared of them.
